column4: Anyone know if there's any configuration changes needed to connect to a remote server (not linux) from an ubuntu workstation using XDMCP ?
I'm just getting a black screen when I connect
Or, barring that, just an explaination of the protocol/connection proceedure would be good
If you really want to do that, then read the man page for gdm.conf,  enable the XDMCP chooser, and set AllowAdd=true
th0r: It's connecting to a OpenVMS system, and I don't administrate it, so I can't switch to X-forwarding over ssh =(
It lets your users enter a host name for the remote XDMCP host.
Or you can create an ini [section] for pre-defined hosts.

oh. Well XDMCP chooser is coming up fine, and the host is listed there already.. But when attempting to connect it does not give me the hosts login prompt. Just shows me a blank x server with a cursor and sits there.
What is the remote host running?  Many systems will require appropriate hosts.allow or hosts.deny entries.
OpenVMS. And it's not a security setting afaict, because these workstations worked fine using a very old version of fedora to connect
Check the X11 versions.  You may need to do things like disable extensions on the Linux side to connect to an old system.
unless something needs to be configured on the workstation to allow the xdm on the OpenVMS machine to talk to the ubuntu machine.
You should also confirm that a direct DISPLAY= X11 session works properly.
For example,  run `xhost +`,  telnet into the OpenVMS server,  set DISPLAY=mylinuxcomputer:0.0, and run xterm or some other simple program.
If a direct X11 connection doesn't work, then XDMCP won't work.
